title: Cannot create the same folder name as package name
body:
I am using go version go1.7 darwin/amd64.
$GOPATH=~/Go
my project folder structure is 
```
-GO
---bin
---pkg
---src
   |--- `folder_name`
       |--- sort1.go
---main.go
```
I am trying to build my own pkgs and import into main.go.
The pkg name of sort1.go is "sort"
If I name `folder_name` equal "sort", 
then I run `go build sort` `go install sort`, no error msgs output neither sort.a file in pkg.
However, when I name "folder_name" not to equal "sort", like "sortlib" , sortlib.a file show up and every thing work fine.
